tud.se.httpd
Class HttpRequest

java.lang.Object
  tud.se.httpd.HttpRequest
public class HttpRequest
extends java.lang.Object

Parses a clients request.

This class is used by HttpResponse to build the response.

Author:
suesskraut 
part of: tiny-http package: tud.se.httpd
 File: HttpRequest.java

Constructor Summary
HttpRequest(java.net.Socket s)
          Contructs a request while parsing the data from a client socket.

Constructor Detail

HttpRequest

public HttpRequest(java.net.Socket s)
            throws HttpException
Contructs a request while parsing the data from a client socket.

Parameters:
s - The socket from which the data should be parsed.
Throws:
HttpException - is thrown if the socket could not be read or the request is malformed.
Method Detail

parseRequest

protected void parseRequest()
                     throws HttpException

Parses the http request accourding to RFC 2616.

Only the GET request could be served. The only nessary field is the URL of the requested file. All other values are ignored.

Throws:
HttpException

getMethod

public java.lang.String getMethod()

Returns the method of the request. Only GET is supported by this server implementation.

Returns:
The string dsicribing the request method

getTarget

public java.lang.String getTarget()
Returns the URL of the requested target. The server name and the protocol are already removed form it.

Returns:
The requested target on the local file system.

getVersion

public java.lang.String getVersion()
Returns the version string of the http request. It will be passed to the response. So that the response protocol version corresponse to the requests one.

Returns:
the requests protocol version as string

getSocket

public java.net.Socket getSocket()
Returns the client socket from which the request is read. The response must be written to the same socket.

Returns:
the client socket from which the request is read.
